intro: Scabrita triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered scabria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, narrow leaves arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a prominent central disk surrounded by ray florets. Scabrita triflora is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
